prefercite.p: Richard Bryarly. Records, 1786-1804. Accession 22713a-d, Business records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Richard Bryarly was a farmer, ferryman, moneylender and real estate speculator of the Frederick County, Virginia, area. He bought most of his holdings from the executors of Thomas Bryan Martin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Includes account book of ferriages and merchandise, 1788-1804 (1 vol.); accounts of leases by Denny Fairfax in Fauquier, Frederick, and Shenandoah Counties, Virginia, rents to be collected and unpaid bonds, 1786-1796 (1 vol.); rents received, bonds and notes payable, 1792-1804 (1 vol.); and accounts of leases and rents paid, as well as a list of bonds, 1786-1801 (1 vol.).
